roles: bachelor's degree in actuarial science graduate
supporting_quotes: Sambuli holds a bachelor's degree in actuarial science from the University of Nairobi.

roles: Fellow in the Technology and International Affairs Program
supporting_quotes: Nanjira is a Fellow in the Technology and International Affairs Program at The Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
and a Ford Global Fellow.
She is also President and co-Chair of the Transform Health Coalition
a board member at The New Humanitarian
Development Gateway
and Digital Impact Alliance (DIAL)
and a Commissioner on the Lancet & Financial Times Global Commission (Governing Health Futures 2030).

roles: advisory board member for Technology and Social Justice Initiatives
supporting_quotes: Nanjira also sits on several advisory boards, including the World Economic Forum's Technology and Social Justice Initiatives
Alliance for Inclusive Algorithms

roles: advisory board member for AI and Equality Initiative
supporting_quotes: and the Carnegie Council's AI and Equality Initiative.
Additionally, she is a Diplomacy Moderator at the Geneva Science and Diplomacy Anticipator (GESDA).
Nanjira has served as a Senior Policy Manager and previously as the Digital Equality Advocacy Manager at the World Wide Web Foundation.
Nanjira has served as a Senior Policy Manager and previously as the Digital Equality Advocacy Manager at the World Wide Web Foundation.
Nanjira Sambuli was the former Research Lead and Research Manager at iHub in Nairobi between 2013 and 2016.

roles: member of UN Secretary General's High Level Panel on Digital Cooperation
supporting_quotes: Nanjira is a member of the UN Secretary General's High Level Panel on Digital Cooperation
In 2018, she was invited by António Guterres, the United Nations Secretary General to join the High- Level Panel on Digital Cooperation.

roles: deputy on UN Secretary General's High Level Panel for Women's Economic Empowerment
supporting_quotes: and served as a deputy on the UN Secretary General's High Level Panel for Women's Economic Empowerment (2016–17).

roles: leader of Women's Rights Online work
supporting_quotes: Sambuli led the Women's Rights Online work at the Web Foundation, that comprises a network of gender and digital rights organisations across Africa, Asia and Latin America.
Sambuli developed a framework for accessing the viability, verification and validity of Crowdsourcing, Umati, an online dangerous speech monitoring project.
She is the editor of Innovative Africa.
She also occasionally writes a column for the Daily Nation newspaper in Kenya and international press.
2019 - She was named in the list of BBC 100 Women.
2016 - She was named one of the New African Magazine's 100 Most Influential Africans
